intro: Gomphostemma philippinarum, commonly known as the Philippine gomphostemma, is a climbing shrub native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Menispermaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are typically clustered in axillary inflorescences. Its fruits are fleshy berries that contain several seeds. Gomphostemma philippinarum is often found in tropical rainforests and is adapted to humid, shaded environments.
